== White Board ==

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Artwork/Documentation/Blueprint|Blueprint]]</nowiki>

'''If the desire becomes to create or adopt a tool to manage tasks, what are the requirements?'''

'''Assumptions'''

* Tool will be web based
* Development will be collaborative and transparent
* Process will be intuitive/easy

'''Requirements'''

1. Task must have a community/business sponsor
1.1 Task must capture posting date<<BR>>
1.2 Task must capture desired completion date or ASAP<<BR>>
1.3 Task must have a state ( viz. proposed, active, complete, closed )<<BR>>

2. Task must be assigned

3. Task must have one or more contributors

4. Task must reference a spec ( Wiki ? )
4.1 Task must state purpose<<BR>>
4.2 Task must identify stake holders<<BR>>
4.3 Task must identify requirements<<BR>>
4.4 Task must describe submission process<<BR>>

5. Effort which is defined as large in scope or has several related tasks may be defined as a project ( viz. Icon Project ).
** May share a single spec. :)

'''Risks'''

1. Can the tool be created in a timely manner?

2. Will the change cause a lack of participation?

<<BR>>
'''If the desire becomes to create or adopt a tool to store submissions, what are the requirements?'''

'''Assumptions'''

* Tool will be web based

* Submissions will be appropriately licensed

* Attribution will be given when appropriate

'''Requirements'''

1. Repository must support duplicates or version-ed submissions

2. Repository must support multiple file formats

3. Submissions must link to a task/proposal

4. Submissions must capture threaded comments ( Blog style ? )

5. Submissions must identify submitter

'''Risks'''

1. Can the tool be created in a timely manner?

2. Will the change cause a lack of participation?
